Title:
Morphological and phylogenetic analyses of Amauroderma s.
lat. species generated new genus in Ganodermataceae
Abstract:
Amauroderma s. lat. is contained in Ganodermataceae mainly
based on the morphological features as double-walled basidiospores with
a distinctly ornamented endospore wall. In this work, taxonomic and
phylogenetic studies on Amauroderma s. lat. species within
Ganodermataceae were carried out by morphological even ultrastructual
observations, and molecular phylogenetic analyses of multiple loci (ITS,
nLSU, RPB1, RPB2, TEF1α and βtubulin). One new genus and six new species
are proposed, fourteen related species are described and illustrated.
Three keys to Amauroderma s. str., Foraminispora, Sanguinoderma are
provided respectively.
